boardgame.rpgseries: The Cold and Deathless Northern Darkness Jam Submissions

boardgame.name: MOAR! Monsters Know What They're Doing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the author of The Monsters Know What They’re Doing comes a follow-up strategy guide with MOAR! monster tactics for Dungeon Masters playing fifth edition Dungeons & Dragons.

Keith Ammann’s first book based on his popular blog, The Monsters Know What They’re Doing, unpacks strategies, tactics, and motivations for creatures found in the Dungeons & Dragons Monster Manual. Now, in MOAR! Monsters Know What They’re Doing, he analyzes the likely combat behaviors of more than 100 new enemies found in Volo’s Guide to Monsters and Mordenkainen’s Tome of Foes. Your campaign will never be the same!

boardgame.name: Live to Tell the Tale: Combat Tactics for Player Characters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the author of The Monsters Know What They’re Doing comes an introduction to combat tactics for Dungeons & Dragons players.

In his first book, The Monsters Know What They’re Doing (based on his popular blog), Keith Ammann unleashed upon the D&D world a wave of clever, highly evolved monster tactics. Now it’s only fair that he gives players the tools they need to fight back…and prevail!

An introduction to combat tactics for fifth-edition Dungeons & Dragons players, Live to Tell the Tale evens the score. It examines the fundamentals of D&D battles: combat roles, party composition, attacking combos, advantage and disadvantage, Stealth and Perception, and more…including the ever-important consideration of how to run away!

Don’t worry about creating a mathematically perfect character from square one. Survival isn’t about stats—it’s about behavior! With four turn-by-turn, roll-by-roll, blow-by-blow sample battles, Live to Tell the Tale breaks down how to make the best choices for your cherished characters so that they can survive their adventures, retire upon their accumulated riches, and tell stories about the old days that nobody will ever believe.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Viva para Contar a História Kindle

boardgame.name: An Elf and an Orc Had a Little Baby
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Every humanoid you meet in the worlds of Dungeons & Dragons comes from somewhere. The brassscaled shopkeep in the doorway might have two draconic birth parents, or their birth parents might be a human and a brass dragon. That surly rock gnome seems typical for her kind until she opens her mouth to speak perfect Infernal and explains she was raised in Avernus. When you ask that dwarf walking down the street if he’s born of the mountain dwarves of the western peak or the hill dwarf clan from the southern gully, he might say the truth is a bit of both. And who could forget his adorable dworc twins, one on each arm?

boardgame.name: An Elf and an Orc Had a Little Baby 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Every person you meet in the worlds of Dungeons & Dragons comes from somewhere. The brass-scaled shopkeep in the doorway might have two draconic birth parents, or their birth parents might be a human and a brass dragon. That surly rock gnome seems typical for her kind until she opens her mouth to speak perfect Infernal and explains she was raised in Avernus. When you ask that dwarf walking down the street if he’s born of the mountain dwarves of the western peak or the hill dwarf clan from the southern gully, he might say the truth is a bit of both. And who could forget his adorable dworc twins, one on each arm?

boardgame.name: The Old Hunters DLC
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Old Hunters DLC is the twenty third in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements." It's also the fourth in our Series Four series of zupplements, each detailing some weird angle on the world of #iHunt we wanted to explore.

Inside, you'll find:


A weird phenomenon in the world of #iHunt where podcasters milk otherworldly horrors for their bodily fluids then sell them as vitamin supplements to desperate, aging hunters.
Rules for "Exposure," a system where exposing oneself to the horrors of the great unknown can whittle down one's self-control and ultimately turn a person into a slobbering, mindless beast.
Four Old Hunters to fight, fix, or be hunted by. Beast-addled monsters they're not, but they're this close to being, and your hunters might be the only thing stopping them from being lost forever.
Four horrors, including a hunter lost to exposure, a soul-eating monstrosity, a hunk of flesh and eyeballs, and a mysterious giant monster that answers the question, "can my #iHunter fistfight a demigod?"
Six new "Tricky Weapons," transforming weapons that offer hunters some brutal new tricks and unprecedented versatility on the hunt.

boardgame.name: Unlock!: Les Escape Geeks – Échappez-vous de la Tour Eiffel
boardgame.description:
Unlock! is a series of escape adventures for up to six players. With one hour on the clock, players work through a deck of sixty cards as a team, searching for clues, combining objects, and solving puzzles. The free Unlock! companion app runs the timer while also providing clues, offering hints, and confirming successes. Once the team has reached a solution and entered the correct code into the app, they will escape and win the game!

Unlock!: Les Escape Geeks – Échappez-vous de la Tour Eiffel ("Escape from the Eiffel Tower") is a level 1 adventure featuring Alex and other characters from the Unlock! novels from author Fabien Clavel and publisher Rageot, but no knowledge of these novels is required to solve this challenge.

boardgame.name: Get Out Of My Funeral, Former Best Friend!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Get Out Of My Funeral, Former Best Friend! is a two-player game that makes use of a tarot card system. You play as a ghost and the ghost's former best friend, both of whom are attending the ghost's funeral. The game explores grief, death and broken friendships.

To play, you will need two players and a pack of Tarot cards.
boardgame.rpg: Get Out Of My Funeral, Former Best Friend!

boardgame.name: D.G.S. livro de regras
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Encontre seus amigos em uma taverna, saia em busca de ouro e glória, explore criptas abandonadas, enfrente criaturas abomináveis e viva em um mundo de aventuras fantásticas. Este livreto, papel e caneta, e alguns dados são tudo o que você precisa para explorar um mundo imaginário sem limites. Este material é totalmente compatível com materiais OSR.

Não existe um título específico para a sigla DGS, pode ser qualquer coisa que você imaginar: Dragon Soul, Dungeon Seekers, Dark Gate Spawn. Você, caro mestre ou jogador, é quem faz este jogo, portanto, você também pode decidir o título!

boardgame.name: Dungeoneering
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DUNGEONEERING is a quick-and-dirty tabletop role-playing game where players explore dungeons, gather treasure, and fight monsters. Game Masters are encouraged to use the sample dungeon within, or generate their own with the creation tools, to facilitate these dangerous delves.

boardgame.name: Encounters - Volume V: Wastelands of Hell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There is a Devil inside each Hero.

Imp running a workshop in the middle of wastelands. A giant ribcage of a devil long vanquished. An Erynies waiting for a village to succumb to hellish powers. A snake offering power in exchange for a piece of soul. Dangers await in every corner of underworld… will you dare to challenge the servants of hell in their dominion?

This encounter pack contains 10 carefully designed hell-themed encounters for both the 5th edition and 3.5 edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying games, with monster tactics, leads, hooks, and new monsters and items to spice up your game. Easy to use and drop into any adventure–to fill up blanks on the map, make a long journey more interesting or kickstart another adventure.

boardgame.name: Lost Luggage
boardgame.description:
You and up to three friends are airport luggage porters delivering luggage during the golden age of aviation. Each turn you’ll take Luggage off of the ever-changing Carousel and sort it into your three luggage stacks. Then stack and sort your luggage based on its size and destination, and score points for delivering complete sets to each airplane on time! The cards you take from the Carousel will manipulate the value of completed luggage stacks, so choose carefully!
The game ends when there’s no luggage left to take from the Luggage Carousel. The player with the most points wins!

Card Drafting:
Choose one of the first three cards from the front of the Carousel. Any cards in front of the chosen card will move to the back of the Carousel and add a Boarding Call to their destination(s), which can help or hinder you AND your opponents’ scoring opportunities!

Push Your Luck:
Boarding Calls and Lost Luggage increase the scoring value of each Luggage Card for that destination by 1. Do you deliver your luggage now, or hold out for the highest possible score? Choose wisely, for when a destination receives a fourth Boarding Call, its value resets to 0!

Stacking/Sorting:
Sort your Luggage Cards from smallest to largest to form complete stacks. Keep your Luggage moving! Any cards that can’t fit into your stacks may become Lost Luggage!
Set Collection:
Score completed stacks of luggage heading to the same destination. The more Boarding Calls played, the more points your Luggage Cards are worth! Extra Trolleys will give you one more stack to work with, but will cost you points to use.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: HexGen RPG: Basic Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It is 2052 and the world is sick. Persistent pandemics and the overheating climate have bankrupted most of the world’s governments. Banks and businesses have coalesced into superentities with almost limitless power and private armies. Outside of the shiny corporate office buildings, common people are fighting tooth and nail just to get by. Crime, corruption, and social unrest are at an all-time high.

You play a proxy, a go-between, a handler of things. For you, this struggling world is ripe with opportunity, as everyone is in need of something. Corporations, street gangs, and the common people all need someone who can get things done. All you need is a couple of friends who will have your back and some money to upgrade your cybernetics, software, and equipment as you fight your way from the starving warrens to the upper echelons of power.

In HexGen you will often be presented with hard choices, from character creation – to the fate of the world. Who will you choose as allies and what will you do, when it is your time to make the decisions?

boardgame.name: Litus Saxonicum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Litus Saxonicum ("The Saxon Shore") is a tabletop roleplaying game set in Britain between the years 450 to 500 A.D, during the Anglo-Saxon colonization of the island against its Romano-Brittonic natives.

Gameplay Diversity: The player can be either a Briton, an Anglo-Saxon, a "Celt", or a Roman. Each culture has different norms, rules, and characteristics. Likewise, one is not only a member of a certain culture, but also of a religion and a sub-culture. Therefore there are many possible ways to approach the game, and endless plot development opportunities. One could even use the Expanded Settings of the game to play outside of Britain, in other Migration Period scenarios.

Novel Mechanics: The game contains many unusual mechanics that are often neglected in other games: mechanics for marriages, childbirth, farming, brewing, naval battles, large scale battles, etc. These expanded mechanics allow for a truer representation of the time period.

History: There are sections not only for gameplay, but for pure history as well. The Encyclopedia section details the specifics of the religions, legal systems, and cultures of each society within the game as they existed in the real world. It also contains a timeline of British history from the year 54 B.C to 500 A.D. To the extent that anything is fictionalized by the author, the reader is duly warned. There are optional magical abilities and monsters featured, though even these are strictly based upon period-relevant monsters.

Realism & Complexity: The mechanics are designed to be realistic models - realism has no relation to complexity; sometimes real things are complex, and sometimes they are simple. The mechanics for intuitive facets of life, like "food needs", are kept very simple or even left to the free decision of the game master. By contrast, the mechanics for involved activities like combat are detailed and procedural.

boardgame.name: Disk Masters
boardgame.description:
A Monster Battling/Collecting TTRPG

Publisher's blurb:

In Disk Masters, a party of 2-4 players and a Game Master create the Summons (monsters) of their dreams. Using these Summons, players can explore the Gatcha region created by their GM and become the Disk Masters of the land by either battling their way to victory or saving the Gatcha region from a terrible threat!

boardgame.name: This World Summons Too Many Heroes!!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This World Summons Too Many Heroes!! is a tabletop rpg about regular people being pulled into a fantasy world to become heroes, demon lords, goblins, talking swords, or any kind of adventurer you could think of! Go on an isekai adventure in the Kingdoms of Ceria, where summoning scrolls have been scattered across the countryside and people are recklessly using them to steal people from other worlds and bring them into this one with new powers gifted to them by a goddess of reincarnation.
boardgame.rpg: This World Summons Too Many Heroes!!

boardgame.name: City of Jerry
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are all microscopic organisms that reside within the host body Jerry Smith. Your mission is to keep Jerry alive and breathing.

boardgame.name: Color Life
boardgame.description:
Theme
Color Life is a meta-monopoly family board game. The player will take on the role of little-ü. In the trip he/she will buy some colorful lands, select the abilities and earn money to win the game.

Gameplay
On player's turn, the player rolls one dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he/she has the opportunity to buy it. The land is not exclusive so that all players can buy the same land as if he/she does not own it. The player can use ability card or item card to move instead of rolling a dice.
If a player owns all 3 lands within a color group, he/she may then build building and enable its functionality. Then all players can benefit from that function once they own that land.
There are other lands on the board which can't be bought, they provide other functions such as drawing a random event card, guess other player dice rolling, buy an item card, get new ability cards and earn salary.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Frame Crisis
boardgame.description:
A love letter to the inimitable vibes of classic Mobile Suit Gundam.



As rules lite as it gets. Takes the statless, super-flexible P2AXIS system and expands it with a handful of simple, genre-informed tricks for armored frame skirmishes, character creation, and advancement.



Friendly generators to help you cook up adventure hooks and create distinctive armored frames of various power levels.



Easy character creation lets you customize or randomly generate memorable pilots with real personalities, histories, and relationships.



Six ready-to-play, one-line factions and a table for outlining the scope of your game’s central conflict.



A great entry point for folks who want to run their own mecha melodrama but are put off by the complex rules or highly abstract resolution systems of most Gundam-friendly RPGs. Frame Crisis gives you exactly what you need to play and not one word more.

boardgame.name: ADRIFT
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

That’s when you felt the explosion.

You never saw it coming. You were out there, busy with minor repairs.
In a split second, your body was sent spinning into space.

Adrift is a solo game about inevitability, about grief and belief.

You play an astronaut lost in space, reflecting on your actions as you see your oxygen levels deplete.

You know what's going to happen, it's just a matter of time. The only hope you have is coming to terms with your inevitable death and finding some sort of silver lining amidst hopelessness.
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Littoral Commander: The Indo-Pacific
boardgame.description:
Littoral Commander (formerly Fleet Marine Force) is a 2-6 player boardgame about current and future potential military conflict in the Indo-Pacific region, a hybrid of standard wargames and card-driven games as players spend action points during their turn to activate cards or move units on the game board.

Action points activate stacks (formations) or single units. Ground units have ground and anti-air capabilities, naval units have missile and anti-air capabilities, while air units have strike and anti-air capabilities. LC also features logistics units which are critical for supply since modern forces will run out of ammunition quickly on a battlefield.

In addition to the 'usual' means of battlefield victory, the game also requires players to pay attention to an Influence track which monitors public opinion and can lead to extra resources from home or allied nations. Influence fluctuates through the play of cards/outside events, but also from where combat takes place--fight in urban areas where there will be civilian casualties, and your influence will decrease.

The game comes with standard scenarios but also has a 'living community' which regularly creates other scenarios and situations to play out as well.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Verhängnisvolle Weiten
boardgame.description:
Translation of Perilous Wilds and Perilous Almanacs bundled in one book.

German description from the publisher's website:

Verhängnisvolle Weiten ist ein Zusatzband, mit dem ihr den Horizont eurer Fantasy-Welt erweitert. Die ersten Goblinbauten und Drachenhorte habt ihr geplündert. Nun beweist euch als wahre Abenteurer und folgt dem Lockruf von Reichtum und Ruhm selbst in die fernsten Länder.

Verhängnisvolle Weiten gibt euch umfangreiche Zufallstabellen, neue Spielzüge und Kompendiumsklassen, um eure Reisen und Erkundungen noch spannender zu machen. Das Leben in der Wildnis mag hart und gefährlich sein, aber langweilig wird es nie.

Verhängnisvolle Weiten bedeuten für deine Spielrunde: eigene Karten und fremde Sprachen, unbekannte Landschaften und vergessene Dungeons, loyale Gefolgsleute und bizarre Kreaturen.

Enthalten sind außerdem sechs Almanache – spielfertige Gebiete voller Herausforderungen, damit das Abenteuer sofort weitergeht.

Benötigt das Dungeon World-Regelwerk zum Spielen.

boardgame.name: Denk mich: Wer tickt so wie ich?
boardgame.description:
This is an association game with 55 cards with 6 different questions each.
One player reads the first question and all players write the first word which comes to their mind. All players read their words and the players who selected the same word score 1 point. Now it's the next player's turn who reads the second qustion.
After 3 cards, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Becher-Spiel
boardgame.description:
Below each cup, a token is placed. Each child then lifts three cups in order to find at least 2 tokens which are the same. If that's the case, the child gets the same tokens and the cups are put back on the table.
The child with the most tokens wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Die verrückten Experimente der Microminds
boardgame.description:
Help! The mad MICROMINDS crashed with their spaceship and only you can save them!

Look with your smartphone into the funny world of the Microminds und help them to repair their damaged spaceship. Alot of exiting and informative tasks await you. With varied playful experiments you and the Microminds repair the spaceship part for part. Do you find the best combination for an exiting rocket drive?

A new interactive gaming system from Ravensburger with complex smartphone app and high-quality gaming materials.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mining Colony Duel
boardgame.description:
Mining Colony Duel is a 1-2 player "BYOP" (bring your own pencil) adaptation of Mining Colony, a print-and-play game that requires no components other than the printed sheets and pencils.

In the game, you build a mining colony on a distant planet. At the start of each round, players bid for resources, which include polyomino tiles, domes, landing pads, and science stations. After players reveal their bids, the players place (draw) the resources onto their sheets, trying to accomplish various things, such as having multiple items of the same type in a row or column.

After eight rounds, players score based on the development of their colonies.

boardgame.name: Raketofix
boardgame.description:
The children blow a little rocket from one planet to the other planet. On every planet, they have to solve different tasks which involve some gymnastics, puzzle games or quizzes.
The kid who solves the most tasks wins at the end.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Das Ringelspiel
boardgame.description:
Every player is a visitor on a fairground and tries to drive all the four different wagons of the merry-go-round. But the funny clown tries his best to distract the players and changes the places of the wagons!
The child who first manages to drive all wagons wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Spacy-Racing/Auto-Rennen
boardgame.description:
Two racing games in a single box

Car-racing:
Objective: Be the first ending the car race by passing target space the 3rd time (or more if agreed by the players)
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions for some fields.
On each field only 2 cars are allowed to stay.

Space-racing:
Racing with the Alien "Spacy" through the space in a round course starting from the earth to moon and mars and back.
Objective: Be the first ending the space race by passing field 70.
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions for some fields.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Rauf & Runter
boardgame.description:
A tactical dice game where each player tries to run as fast as possible. At the same time, each one needs to stop at least seven times, but the more you stop, the more points you'll score. What a dilemma...

The winner is the player with the most stops.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Arche Noah
boardgame.description: This is a funny jump & run game for children. The child who is the first one in putting all his animals and Noah in the ark wins the game.

boardgame.name: Wer hat mein Häuschen?
boardgame.description:
The players try to catch the dogs to put them in their corresponding dog kennels.
Each play gets the same amount of dog kennels. All dog cards are put in the middle of the table. The starting player roles the dice three times. If the dice shows at least 2 times the same colour, the player can put one dog in the kennel of this colour.
The player who is the first one in putting the dogs of the correct colours in his dog kennels wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fix und Foxi picknick Memo-Lotto
boardgame.description:
Fix and Foxi make a picnic.
Each player has a board which shows a picnic blanket.
Each picnic blanket has the same 9 elements (picnic theme) printed on it.

Objective:
Complete your picnic as first, but don't pick the mice.
On players turn he selects one memory tile and turns it open.
If it's an element he still needs (not covered by an equal tile or a mouse tile) he takes and places it. Otherwise he turns it on the back side at the old position.
If the player finds a mouse he can choose if he place it on 1 free field on his blanket or if he puts it back.
The game ends, when 1 player has placed 1 tile on each of the 9 fields on his blanket.
Every player removes all mice and 1 good tile for each mouse tile from his blanket. For every remaining tile he gets 1 point. The player who ends the game gets 2 additional points. The player with the highest amount of points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Boss in der Bank
boardgame.description:
The player are employees in a bank who want to become CEO. Therefore, each player needs to answer questions and if he knows the right answer, he moves up the corporate ladder.
The fastest and most skilled player will become CEO and win the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Wortspiel
boardgame.description:
This is a collection of word games where children can easily learn the different senses of various word pairs.
It contains 48 tokens which form 24 pairs.

Puzzle game for 2-6 children
One half of the pairs is put face up on the table, whereas the other half is put face down. Then one of hidden tokens is put face up as well and the children have to find the corresponding partner. The fastest child gets the pair. In the end, the child with the most pairs wins.

Memory game for 2-6 children
All tokens are put face down on the table and the children try to find pairs according to the actual memory rules. The one with the most pairs wins.

Homonym game for 4-6 children
2 kids secretly take one word pair and both of them explain their word to the other children. The child who is the first one to guess the word wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Chapter 4: The Moonlight Escapade
boardgame.description:
Chapter IV sees you infiltrating a small desert camp to locate and decipher a secret message left for you.

You must figure out your next steps by examining the items left in the camp, deconstructing them and reforming them into new tools.

---

Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rekorde Quiz
boardgame.description:
A simple quiz card game with 107 cards. Each card covers a specific topic about world records in sports, culture etc. with 4 questions. The answers are on the backside of the cards. Players try to answer the questions and score points.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Erzähl mir was!: Wiener Spielschule
boardgame.description:
This game encourage children to remember and explain easy stories. It contains 50 tokens with images of some terms, such as apple, bike, street. These tokens are put face down on the 8 fields of the game board.
In the first round, the starting player turns the tokens of one field face up and tells a fairy tale inclduing all the terms of the tokens on his field. He puts the tokens face down again and the next player starts to tell a story about the next field.
In the second round, the children have to remember the terms. Therefore, a field is selected randomly and the player mentions all the terms of this field. For every correct one, he gets the token.
The child with the most tokens wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Die Simpsons: Drunter und Drüber in Springfield
boardgame.description:
Each player is one of 8 "The Simpsons" characters.
There are 5 Springfield locations (Kwik-E-Market, School, Moe's bar, nuclear power plant, TV channel). On each location the player can gat a typical thing (e.g. beer at Moe's), a new order card or fullfill an order card he has on his hand.
The player who fullfills 3 order cards first, wins the game.
On players turn he can choose 1 of 4 moving possibilities (monorail, car, skate board, feet). There are differences in cost, speed and precision.
2 additional rules: moving by feet allows to move the barrier (drunken Barnie), which blocks the monorail and the street (for all except skate board).
On each order card there is a "being mean" possibility. This can be done for free if you fullfill the order. The victim can be choosen. It can also be executed by giving back one order card and an additional thing.

boardgame.name: Tier Legespiel
boardgame.description:
The cards with half funny pictures of animals are shuffled and dealt evenly to the players. The players now play cards in turn. If the next player can complete an animal, he may take the cards. If not, then he must place another card in front of him.
Whoever has collected the most complete animals at the end wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Chapter V: Serpents of the Sand
boardgame.description:
Chapter V invites you to investigate an archaeological excavation site in the desert. Starting with a battered journal and some cryptic notations, you find four dig sites across which 12 scales of a great beast are scattered.

You must follow the archaeologist's eleven-day research mission to locate the resting place of a fallen star.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chapter VI: Milton Manor
boardgame.description:
Chapter VI brings you to the stately Milton Manor. From a mysterious note slid under your hotel room door, you know to examine the portraits, blueprints, and books you find in the house.

You must locate and unlock the vault in the manor to complete the investigation and recover the shard before your adversaries get there first.

---
Audience

boardgame.description:
As you are chased in a speeding van, you must use everything you've learnt as a Guardian to access the Mysterious Companies files.

---
Audience

boardgame.name: Chapter VIII: Thornhill Forest
boardgame.description:
We believe that a former Guardian is living in isolation in the ancient forest of Thornhill. Before we lost contact with him, he left two things for us: a utility knife and a tin with a compass and some polaroids. We are entrusting you with these items, knowing that you have the tools to find him.

---
Audience

boardgame.name: Chapter IX: The End of the Line
boardgame.description:
You board a train with one of our allies. Make sure that you have the run of the vehicle; however, you may need to keep things on track with your quick thinking and decoding skills.

---
Audience

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl: (Second Season Edition) – Glorious Gifts Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promo card found in Issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

"Every year, gifts are exchanged at the end of the season. Will our players get what they wished for this year? Or will it be more patterned socks and spare underwear!"

TIMING

Play this card during the pre-game sequence, after step 5 but before step 6.

DURATION

This card expires at the end of this game.

EFFECT

When you play this card, select a player on your team, roll a D6 and apply the corresponding effect until this card expires:

On a 1, the selected player has opened a brand new pair of socks Woo. This card has no additional effect.
On a 2-3, the selected player gains a Primary Skill of your choice.
On a 4-5, the selected player gains a Primary Skill, Secondary Skill or a Trait of your choice.
On a 6, the selected player may improve their MA, ST, AG or PA by 1.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: GeekyGameyGadgets Insert/Organizer
boardgame.description:
Laser cut organizer for your copy of Lost Ruins of Arnak the board game.

This custom MDF insert holds all the pieces for the Lost Ruins of Arnak. Game setup is faster because trays rest directly on the board. No need to stack temple tiles in a perfect pyramid -- just use the tray!

Trays include customized engravings depicting their contents, so it's easy to see what goes where. Resource trays are low-profile, so it's easy to see what's in them when you're seated across the table.

Fully compatible with sleeved cards. Allows game to be stored however you want: horizontally or vertically. The trays have extra space to to accommodate custom pieces. (For expansion support, please see our separate Arnak + Expeditions expansion insert.)

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Does not include the game itself. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Does not include the game itself. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.

boardgame.description:
You enter the sewer system underneath the looming tower. Will you be able to navigate the winding tunnels with what you have on you?

boardgame.description:
You arrive at the tower of Starfall Corporation. You find a note with a simple message 'Floor Sixty-Four' - the Restricted Research Department. There must be some clues left behind that points to the last artifacts. It's time to start exploring Floor Sixty-Four!

Will you be able to locate the last artifacts?

boardgame.name: Necromunda: Underhive – A Swig Of Wild Snake Tactics Card
boardgame.description:
Card was available in issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

Play this gang tactic when activating a friendly fighter.

Place the thin end of the Flame template in contact with the active friendly fighter. All fighters touched by the Flame template (both friend and foe) gain the Intoxicated condition and the Doused in Alcohol condition. Playing this card counts as the chosen fighter's activation.

Intoxicated fighters are marked with an Intoxicated token and suffer a -1 penalty to BS and WS checks for the remainder of the battle. For the remainder of the battle, fighters Doused In Alcohol are automatically set on fire the first time they are hit by a weapon with the Blaze trait.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – GeekyGameyGadgets Insert/Organizer
boardgame.description:
Laser cut organizer for your copy of Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition the board game.

Are you frustrated with the scoring (terraform rating) track? Tired of scores moving when the table is bumped? The insert includes individual scoring trackers for each player!

This custom MDF insert holds all the pieces for the Ares Expedition. It's fully compatible with sleeved cards. The card tray includes lots of extra space for additional promos or possible expansions. Allows game to be stored however you want: horizontally or vertically.

Retail version: If you purchased your game at retail (non-Kickstarter), this insert is for you. The cube trays have slanted edges to make it easy to pull out the cubes. There are two such trays so all players can be within easy reach of the counters.

Retail w/ Acrylic: Same as above, but also includes acrylic player mat overlays. This is a great upgrade that holds all the pieces in place on your boards. 1/8" thick, crystal clear, and sturdy.

Deluxe (Kickstarter) version: If you own the deluxe Kickstarter version, this insert fits the plastic trays that you already have. If you would prefer to use our resource trays instead of the plastic KS trays, please place an order for the "retail edition." The only difference is whether our resource trays are included (retail) or not (Kickstarter).

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Does not include the game itself. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – GeekyGameyGadgets Acrylic Overlays
boardgame.description:
A set of four laser cut acrylic overlays for your copy of Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition the board game.

This is a great upgrade that holds all the pieces in place on your player boards. 1/8" thick, crystal clear, and sturdy. Acrylic overlays are safely shipped with a protective paper that must be peeled off before using.

There are two ways to use the overlays. It is completely up to your personal preference.
1) Rest them atop the player mats when you play the game. They ensure you won’t lose track of your resources, even if they are bumped
2) Use a spray adhesive to permanently attach them to the player mats. Ensure that you apply spray adhesive to the back of the acrylic (not to the mat).

If you're frustrated with the default scoring (terraform rating) track, we also offer individual scoring trackers for each player. Just select it as an add-on when you place your order.

Looking for an entire organizer instead? Check out our other listings for this and other games.

boardgame.name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Ordnance Delivery Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Card found in Issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

As two battlegroups clash, low-orbit aircraft brave the blizzard conditions to unleash blind bombing runs upon the two sides.

If all players agree, the card can be added to an existing Open Engine War deck or used on its own. At the start of each Strategy phase, the First Player rolls a D10. Until the end of the round, the long range characteristic of all weapons is reduced by a number of inches equal to the number rolled (to a minimum of the weapon's short range). In addition, each player, starting with the player who is not the First Player, may place a 5" Blast marker anywhere on the battlefield and Scatter it D10 inches. Any model at least partially under the template suffers D3 S7 Hits, as if hit by a weapon with the Ordnance trait.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy Rules Set

boardgame.name: Bowling Kids
Kegel Knirpse
Les Petit Joueurs de Quilles
I Piccoli Giocatori Di Birilli
boardgame.description:
It's a bowling for kids.
Additional the kids should use the mages for building pyramids with them to train their mechanical abilities.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mario Party Super Stars
Mario Party Superstars
boardgame.description:
Mario Party Superstars[a] is a 2021 party video game developed by NDcube and published by Nintendo for the Nintendo Switch. It is the twelfth home console installment in the Mario Party series, and the second for the Nintendo Switch following Super Mario Party (2018). It was released on October 29, 2021.[1]

The game features five remade boards from the original Nintendo 64 trilogy of games and a total of 100 mini-games curated from previous entries in the series,[2] similar to the Nintendo 3DS title Mario Party: The Top 100 (2017). Unlike Super Mario Party, Superstars can be played with button controls.[3] Upon release, Mario Party Superstars received mostly positive reviews from critics.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Family Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories 2
boardgame.description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering battle of Starzone Vanfleet and 6th siege of Iserlhon.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles

boardgame.name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories 3
boardgame.description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering battle of Dagon star zone and 2nd battle of Tiamat Star zone.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Escape Adventures: Von Wikingern und Runenmagie
boardgame.description: Family friendly escape game in a viking age setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based in the age of the group and the used hints.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Pékin Express
boardgame.description:
Pékin Express the board game is a race in which the players will move across Europe or Asia and collect points. The game ends when a player reaches the finish line (Lisbon or Beijing) and the player with the most Amulet points wins.

Once the board chosen (Asia for 2 to 4 players ; Europe for 4 to 6 players) and the setup complete, the first round begins. A round is structured as follows:

The players draft their 5 Travel cards.
The player with the Red Flag card in hand must play it and take the Red Flag token. Then they take their turn by playing a Travel card or by passing. When a player reaches first a city with no Stage Token, they gain a face down Amulet card and place a Stage Token on that city.
The players continue to take their turn in order in a similar fashion until every player has passed consecutively.


Such rounds keep going until the end of the game is triggered immediately as soon as a player reaches the finishing line (and by doing so, they gain 3 Amulet cards).

Each player counts their Amulet values, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Feywild Name Giver
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Journey to Barrenland, a Domain of Delight inspired by Brazil's Northeaster songs (Forró)

An inhospitable land where towering cacti forest provides shelter from the scorching sun. Stubborn albeit altruistic fey gather in small communities to survive the arid and rugged terrain.

Explore the Feywild

Assist a small kobold in crossing the desert and finding a fey name-giver who might help them name their new hatchlings.

Escort the kobold through a series of whimsical and improbable encounters only possible in the Feywild.

Fight a powerful fey

A trio of evil fey plan to dethrone the ruling Archfeys. One of them plans to kidnap the name-giver for their own evil purposes.

Only brave adventurers may be able to stop them!

The Feywild: The Domain of Delight, Barrenland.

Barrenland is mostly a desert thorn forest. Its vegetation includes cacti, small thorny trees and occasional depressions that hold pockets of water.

The adversarial nature of the domain put the two Archfey the Black Hawk, Carcara, and the White Dove, Asa Branca, in eternal bickering!

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 2.

CONTENT ADVISORY: animal cruelty, environmental hazards (wildfire, heatwave), possible phobia (snakes), abuse (manipulation)
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: What's So Mysterious, Detective Girls?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Your characters are great at finding clues! When your detectives enter a scene, they should be able to find at least two clues right away. Using your talents and rolling dice can reveal more about the clues or help you connect them together.

boardgame.name: The Great Axe By
The GreatAxeBy
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The famous novel of a man's ruthless drive to wealth - now retold as a dungeon crawler.

boardgame.name: If Not Swords, Then Claws
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

If Not Swords, Then Claws is a collaborative story game about creating a children's fantasy book series about heroes and dragons learning to work together to defeat evil.

boardgame.name: Academy of Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

No finer training can be found, either up or down the Sword Coast, than that of Headmaster Vance’s Academy of Adventure. Here, an adventurer can learn firsthand from the masters of their craft. However, not everything is as it appears, and beneath the Academy’s prosaic exterior lies a dark and terrible secret...

The Academy Of Adventure can be used as a setting as well as an adventure. As an adventure it contains more than enough material to advance the characters from 1st through 3rd level. It includes a campus description, two semesters worth of curricula, a detailed student body, new monsters, and a new magic item.

Although accessible to veteran players, the adventure is true to its name and provides many opportunities for the DM to “teach” the game to new players. It can easily be used as a springboard into any larger campaign, but is optimized as a lead-in to the Rise Of Vecna, the second installment of the Doomed Forgotten Realms adventure path.

boardgame.name: Booms, Heals, and Bleedings
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Additional mechanics for craft-based characters.

Publisher's blurb:

This comprehensive supplement aims to provide users with mechanics for Bombs, more detailed Alchemy, poisonmaking, and more. This is great for DMs who want more realistic mechanics, playing without a magic user, or campaigns that have a lot gems and nothing to use them on!

boardgame.name: Lofwyr's Legions
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurp:

'IN THE SHADOW OF DRAGONS
Shadowrunners know that the most dangerous position to have in the Sixth World is being perceived as a threat by the powerful. Drakes are the perfect example—their power is considerable, which means they almost always have someone after them. They often end up seeking protection by serving dragons and doing their bidding—which means they represent dragons’ interests in the shadows. Runners need to know about drakes, because they could mess up their lives in short order. Or, if they’re lucky, become one of the greatest friends or even teammates a runner could have.

Lofwyr’s Legions offers short fiction, NPCs, character qualities, and rules for involving drakes in your Shadowrun, Sixth World game.

boardgame.name: Learning Little from Victory
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurp:

POLITICS AS A BLOOD SPORT
When the Yakuza decide to get involved with local politics, what could go wrong? Shadowrunners in Neo-Tokyo are about to find out. Runners are going to be asked to influence the election, and they’ll have to deal with the candidates, their backers, and anyone else who wants things to go their way. They’ll have plenty of obstacles to overcome and decisions to make—are they just going to work for pay, or will they try to get the right person into office? Assuming they can decide who that is.

SRM 09-03 Learning Little from Victory is a Mission that can be used with both Shadowrun, Fifth Edition and Shadowrun, Sixth World.

boardgame.name: The Ultimate Guide to Alchemy, Crafting & Enchanting
boardgame.description:
(Back Cover)

Get Your Hands Dirty

The Ultimate Guide to Alchemy, Crafting & Enchanting is a comprehensive companion for not only magic items, but organically integrating item creation into your 5e games.

Rise through the ranks of the associations that oversee the varied studies of alchemy, crafting, and enchanting. Each rank comes with new recipes and benefits, but be careful, because if you don’t adhere to the association's principles, you could fail into bad standing, or worse. Don’t worry - for the rule-breakers and rebels, there’s always the black market…

Finally, this book contains tables for the harvesting and foraging of ingredients, hundreds of recipients for both new and existing items, and 200 brand new, ready-to-use magic items.

With this guide’s help, you can become a master crafter, and forge some of the most powerful artifacts the realms have ever seen.

boardgame.name: The Ultimate Random Encounters Book
boardgame.description:
(Back Cover)

Take your gaming to the next level!

Sick of combat scenarios slowing to a repetitive grind?
Does your game master occasionally run out of NPC ideas?
Has your game gone so many rounds that even your most beautifully planned encounter has gone stale?

Instead of spending hours prepping your next RPG, just open this book for hundreds of ideas designed to slot right into your existing campaign, organized into easy-to-use tables.

Got a pre-existing world but you’re running dry on things to have the party do in it?

Flip to Part 1 and roll up one of our random encounters.

Got the rough sketches of an encounter but need to flesh it out?

Fill in the rest from the game masters tools in Part 2.

If you love wild, unexpected die results, you already know it can also be fun to throw caution to the wind and let randomness determine as much as possible. Even the most organized GMs and the tightest adventure modules benefit from a little spice!

Challenge and entertain your fellow gamers - no matter what you’re playing - with The Ultimate Random Encounters Book.

boardgame.name: Vrahode: The Calteeryn Ascension
boardgame.description:
Vrahode - The Calteeryn Ascension is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game, the first in a series of four games, designed by Jeffrey Irving. The game is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players, 14+ and includes Weathervane Games proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger which is used for dynamic multi level spaces. The victory condition in this game's campaign is achieved by the "Calteeryn" player learning the magic from each race in the game while facing mounting threats. This is done by questing in the Vrahode overland map, on the oceans and in the vast Underlands. Dice combat enhanced by powerful skill cards and racial abilities unique to each race. Enemy AI deck changes enemy behavior each encounter! The world of Vrahode is based on a narrative first imagined in 1990 by designer Jeffrey Irving. The Vrahode series of games includes three additional expansions: The Enlightened & The Enslaved, Facing The Storm and The False Gods' Deceit. All are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Holly Jolly: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Card Set
boardgame.description:
Available as part of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

This set of Present cards consists of three total cards, one each of the following items: Dice Tower, Dice, and Board Games.

These three cards can be shuffled into your presents/stockings deck. At the end of the game if a player manages to collect one card from this set, they score 1 point. If they can get two, they score 2 total points. But if they can manage to collect all three, then they will earn a big ol 18 points!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Roaring 20's Femme Fatale Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Femme Fatale, vamp, maneater, siren, temptress. An attractive and seductive woman who is likely to cause distress or disaster to a man who becomes involved with her. In the pulp world of the roaring 20’s, women found new power and freedom to vote, claim birth control, experiment with speakeasies, and dress wildly with the newest dances. Scorned by conservatives and discovered by the press, some of these colorful women want nothing less than to realize the full extend of their newfound influence and power.

This system-agnostic roleplaying product can quickly give you millions of different combinations to generate interesting and dangerous women. Built for the Roaring 20s genre of games (like Gangbusters, Call of Cthulhu, Pulp Hero, Justice Inc., etc.), this set of nine tables lets you create a dangerous dame or bad broad with a quickly generated background and history, and enough details to catch the attention of any male set before her. While we touch on their physicality, this product is about building characters that players can interact with, and not two-dimensional eye candy. Out of respect for female players, we have also tried to use genre-specific phrases and avoid sexist terms, even as we acknowledge the relentless sexuality of the situation.

This set of 9 tables requires twenty sided dice (1d20) and ten sided dice (1d10) to use.

boardgame.name: Roaring 20's Bounty Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The concept of bounties and bounty hunters has been around since people first managed to successfully escape into the wilderness to evade the long arm of the law. And during the time of prohibition, high profile and organized crimes surged into the public like never before.

This list is intended for any game in the Roaring 20’s genre (like Gangbusters, Call of Cthulhu, Pulp Hero, Justice Inc., etc.). Whether the fugitive is a lowdown thief or an innocent framed for a crime they didn’t commit, this table can help you generate a fugitive with an interesting background, and more than just a number placed on their head.

This product uses a set of nine tables / charts to generate details about the fugitive, the crime, the bounty itself, the original victims of the crime, and the current circumstances. This set of 9 tables requires twenty sided dice (1d20) and ten sided dice (1d10) to use.

Check out D10 Dimensions on DrivethruRPG for additional Roaring 20s products to generate a long list of your speakeasies, caches of loot, teams of G Men, old cars, beautiful femme fatales, dark asylums, or a range of items for any pocket, hideout or hidden box in an old basement somewhere.

boardgame.name: 100 Cyber City Treasures Vol 5: Bearer Bonds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bearer bonds were first introduced in the late 1800s to fund post-Civil War reconstruction. Nations and corporations in the Cyberpunk world can get capital by offering bonds to store wealth with decent and stable interest rates. Instantly popular, bearer bonds use nano-tech in the paper to make them impossible to counterfeit. This system-agnostic list of 100 bearer bonds (and their coupons) allows you to add this new wealth to any Cyberpunk setting.

How they work: Bonds are a debt vehicle to help a company or government raise capital. Anyone with the money can buy a bearer bond, and unlike other bonds, their ownership is anonymous (like cash). Coupons are included so that they can be redeemed at preset interest rates on an annual basis. The bond itself can be turned in for cash at any time, but any coupons that haven’t matured are worthless. There is no legal recourse if the bearer bond or coupons is lost, stolen or destroyed (like cash). If the issuing company or nation collapses, then the bonds are worthless. Bond holders are expected to book an appointment to cash out large numbers of bonds (but not coupons). Often, when bond holders need to represent a large amount of capital, it's more likely to have a number of smaller bonds rather than just one single large bond (it's more common to see 10 bonds worth 800 credits each, than a single 8,000 credit bond).

boardgame.name: 50 Craft Beers of Cyber City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the futuristic genre of Cyberpunk, drugs are a common way to manipulate the masses and rack up some hefty corporate profits. And this includes offering cheap and addictive beer. Independent brewers have emerged to meet the need of thirsty citizens who want a strong drink after a long day in the rain but who don’t want to become a depressed suicidal addict after a six pack of doctored beer.

This tool can be added to any dark future campaign (like Cyberpunk Red, Altered Carbon, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, etc.) where a bold and independent brewery exists to make quality beer. NOTE: All of the craft beers / illustrated cans in this product are produced and available in the real world from Zero Issue Brewing ( https://www.zeroissuebeer.com/ ). This is not a paid advertisement - we just like their charity work in the community, and we want to promote and support another creative small business.

boardgame.name: 100 Superhero Skyfalls Vol 1: Modern City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skyfall happens when a person or object falls to Earth. Whether this is a hero (or villain) falling from the sky, dropping an object, or if a vehicle lands by accident or on purpose - the question remains: WHERE DID YOU LAND?

This product is intended for any modern superhero setting (like Villains and Vigiliantes, Supers, Champions, Mutants & Masterminds, Marvel Super Heroes, Icons, Prowlers and Paragons, Masks, Superhuman, Superworld, Heroes Unlimited, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, etc.) where the setting and technology mirror the world around us.

NOTE: Entries marked with an "*" are generally somewhat more forgiving of falling objects or people than other areas, and the Game Master is encouraged to reduce damage accordingly.

boardgame.name: 350 Items in a Cyber City Vending Machine Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The futuristic vending machines of Cyber City have naturally filled the void that many small stores used to occupy. These new self-contained vending machines commonly dispense goods, and are armed with military grade weapon systems to protect the goods and the machine itself from gangs, cyberpsychos, and all the desperate common citizens. The vendors are filled with newly found products from neglected shipping containers, forgotten warehouses and abandoned factories.

This tool can be added to any dark future roleplaying game (like Cyberpunk 2020, Cyberpunk Red, Altered Carbon, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, GURPS Cyberpunk, Android, Aeon Flux, Rifts, and more) where stores and shops are the exception, not the norm.

NOTES (*): Bash beer is a common street drug with addictive properties engineered into it. On the other hand, Bash beer is designed to be addictive and cheap. * For detailed examples of Craft Beer, see the D10 Dimension's offering 50 Craft Beers of Cyber City.

boardgame.name: Cyberfashion Generator Vol 1 - Tattoos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tattoo. Ink. Tat. Brand. This kind of body alteration can be largely decorative, symbolic, or a way of representing who a person is, or who they admire. While there are literally billions of different tattoos in this world, it can be very hard for a future focused survivor to settle exactly on what they want to have etched on their flesh. This expansive little tool can help you sort it all out.

I have wanted this tool for a very long time. You can apply this system-agnostic tool set to any cyberpunk genre (like Cyberpunk 2020, Cyberpunk Red, Altered Carbon, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, Android, GURPS Cyberpunk, Rifts, etc.) that has a dash of fashion to go with every hail of bullets, and roar of the aerodynes.

The nine tables that make up this product will help you determine all kinds of facts about your tattoo, like where the tattoo is located, the size of the tattoo, whether it’s part of a set of tattoos, it’s dominant colors, the image and style being adopted, an array of interesting sub-features for cyber-enhanced tattoos, who built the tattoo, why they got the tattoo in the first place, and some of the psychology behind possessing these distinctive tattoos. And if that’s more detail than you need, you can always ignore or pass over any tables or results that don’t interest you.

boardgame.name: 200 Names of Cyber City Tattoo Parlors
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tattoo. Ink. Tat. Brand. This kind of body alteration can be largely decorative, symbolic, or a way of representing who a person is, or who they admire. While there are literally billions of different tattoos, it can be hard for a future focused survivor to settle on exactly where they want to have ink etched on their flesh. So this little tool gives them or you a wealth of places to choose from.

You can apply this system-agnostic tool set to any cyberpunk genre (like Cyberpunk 2020, Cyberpunk Red, Android, Rifts, Altered Carbon, Shadowrun, Carbon 2185, GURPS Cyberpunk, etc.) with a dash of fashion to go with every hail of bullets, and roar of the aerodynes. You’ll find an interesting array of shop names to draw in the crowds.

boardgame.name: 100 Items in a Wild West Snake Oil Salesman's Pocket
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Snake Oil Salesmen typically work by different titles. Some will call them Doctor or Professor, while others will call them quacks, hucksters, and charlatans. These well-dressed frauds travel with their medicine wagons around the old West offering medicine to those hopeful or desperate enough to believe their claims of salvation. And once in a while their claims are true ...

This list is intended for any Western game (like Boot Hill, Tall Tales, Deadlands, Wild West, Shooting Iron, etc.) where patches of civilization cluster around a small town or old fort. This list can be applied to a cornered con man, a greedy and grim money grubbing gent, or just as a way to add new dimension to your next plotting professor or dodgy doctor. NOTE: With this tool we sometimes refer to the Snake Oil Salesman with the abbreviation: SOS.

boardgame.name: 100 Kinds of Deep Space Cargo - Vol 1: Science
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the endless reaches of deep space, tools and possessions can be hard to come across. Cargo can be found in outposts, storage lockers, warehouses, ships, spaceports, storage rooms and so on. Whether they are highly coveted or collecting dust, these items can alter the outcome of a battle, be sold for needed credits, save a settlement or even just be used for their intended purpose.

This tool contains 100 kinds of cargo intended for any space opera setting (like Traveller, Star Wars, Star Trek, Space Opera, Rifts, Babylon 5, Red Dwarf, Alien, etc.) where technology is not necessarily uniform or simple. Containers are divided into Boxes (smaller containers like sealed boxes, suitcases and the like) or Crates (larger containers that typically require two people to move). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a wide range of new options to your next storage room.

boardgame.name: 100 Kinds of Deep Space Cargo - Vol 2: Medical
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the endless reaches of deep space, medical tools, information, and technology can be hard to come across. Whether the cargo is highly coveted or collecting dust, these items can alter the outcome of a disaster, be sold for needed credits, or even just be used for their intended purpose.

This tool contains 100 kinds of cargo intended for any space opera setting (like Traveller, Star Wars, Star Trek, Space Opera, Rifts, Babylon 5, Red Dwarf, Alien, etc.) where technology is not necessarily uniform or simple. Containers are divided into Boxes (smaller containers like sealed boxes, suitcases and the like), Crates (larger containers that typically require two people to move), Samplepods and Lifepods (for containing samples and people safely in stasis).

boardgame.name: 100 Kinds of Deep Space Cargo - Vol 3: Contraband
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the endless reaches of deep space, illegal drugs, weapons, and secrets can be hard to come across. Whether the cargo is highly coveted or collecting dust, these items can alter the outcome of a battle, be sold for needed credits, or even just be used for their intended purpose.

This tool contains 100 kinds of cargo intended for any space opera setting (like Traveller, Star Wars, Star Trek, Space Opera, Rifts, Babylon 5, Red Dwarf, Alien, etc.) where technology is not necessarily uniform or simple. Containers are divided into Boxes (smaller containers like sealed boxes, suitcases and the like), Crates (larger containers that typically require two people to move), Samplepods and Lifepods (for containing samples and people safely in stasis). NOTE: Use this list sparingly - these results can alter a campaign.

boardgame.name: 350 Names for a Spaceship - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the endless reaches of deep space, spaceships are a lifeline for people and places. Spaceships can be found just about anywhere - with outposts, smugglers, warehouses, spaceports, battlefields, and so on. Whether they are highly coveted or collecting dust, these vehicles of war or exploration can alter the outcome of a battle, or alter the fate of entire worlds...

boardgame.name: 350 Names for a Spaceship - Vol 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the endless reaches of deep space, spaceships are a lifeline for people and places. Spaceships can be found just about anywhere - with outposts, smugglers, warehouses, spaceports, battlefields, and so on. Whether they are highly coveted or collecting dust, these vehicles of war or exploration can alter the outcome of a battle, or alter the fate of entire worlds...

boardgame.name: The Rotting Plaza
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined spiked city is overgrown with horrible, fleshy protuberances. They bubble up from the ground and coat the sides of crumbling steel-and-stone buildings. It stinks of death, and disease.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Forest Library
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A huge library in a temperate rainforest, built out of sturdy stone. Wildflowers climb stone pillars which frame windows and entryways, while a secret room with a glowing red book waits at its heart.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Haunted Library
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A huge library in a dead, cursed forest. Everything outside it looks like it’s turning to ash. Dead wildflowers cling to windows and entryways, while a secret room with a glowing red book waits at its heart...

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Shadowlands Library
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A huge library in a dead, cursed forest, filled with crimson mushrooms. Everything outside it looks like it’s turning to ash, except for the fungus and strange, fleshy growth which stretches between surfaces. Blood red sap and spores stain everything around them. Dead wildflowers cling to windows and entryways, while a secret room with a glowing red book waits at its heart...

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Villains of Russia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Red Menace!

With the fall of the Soviet Union, the Motherland has seen many of its superhuman creations turn to greed and crime. The Russian Mafia has a number of superhuman leaders and enforcers within its ranks.

boardgame.name: The Search for Darwah's Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your party has been tasked with finding the hidden city of Belwah, lost in ages past beneath the shifting sands of the Blighted Lands, and within it, the forsaken Temple of Darwah. Retrieve the life-giving waters from this temple and the people of Chentoufi will reward you handsomely. Fail and you might be considered lucky of you are among the dead. A fantasy adventure through Luke Gygax's world of the Okkorim for 6-8 characters level 7-10. Fully compatible with 5th Edition.

boardgame.name: WARNO
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Players command US/NATO or Soviet Union/Warsaw Pact forces in this real time tactical strategy game, that serves as a spiritual successor to the Wargame Series, again imagining an alternate history where the Cold War has gone hot.
